descript.abstract: U.S. State Plane Zones - NAD 1927 represents the State Plane Coordinate System (SPCS) Zones for the North American Datum of 1927 within United States. Several State Plane Coordinate System zones are not shown in this dataset, including Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands, American Samoa, Guam, and Louisiana's offshore zone.
descript.purpose: U.S. State Plane Zones - NAD 1927 is generalized and an approximation of the actual State Plane Coordinate System zone boundaries for the North American Datum of 1927. It is intended for visual reference at small and medium map scales. Check with state authorities if you have a question about a zone boundary.

In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired. The data set boundaries are approximations of the actual State Plane Coordinate System zone boundaries.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.title: ArcData® Online GIS Data on the web –U.S. State Plane Zones Data Set

procstep.procdesc: This data set was created from several sources: Extracted state boundaries from ArcUSA™ 1:25M. Created state plane boundaries based on a graphic in the article, "A National Reference System and its Relationship to Mapping" by Alden P. Colvocoresses at the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), and John P. Snyder's "An Album of Map Projections: A Working Manual" (1987: USGS Professional Paper 1395. U.S. Government Printing Office: Washington, D.C.).

The following steps were performed by Esri for Data & Maps 2002: Removed independent city void areas in Virginia. The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile, spcs_zone.zip, from https://www.esri.com/data/online/esri/datapacks/stateplane.html and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue™ request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by Esri: Added SQMI attribute and calculated its values.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Renamed attribute ZONENAME27 to ZONE. Renamed FIPSZONE27 to FIPSZONE. Added attribute ZONENAME and calculated its values with the descriptions of attribute ZONE. Added attribute COLORMAP and calculated its values from 1 to 5.
Converted the dataset into a file geodatabase.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent areas for the State Plane Coordinate System zones for the North American Datum of 1927 within United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey)

codesetd.codesets: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey)

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the zone.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The measure of area in square miles.
The number allows the zone to be colored uniquely from its neighbors.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
